--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> Francisco Hernandez wrote:
> 
> > i've just begun to use junit but im having some troubles trying to
> > setup some resources ie: (an ApplicationContext for Spring)
> > 
> > I was attempting to do something like this in my TestCase
> > 
> > public void setUp() {
> >         if (appContext == null) {
> >            // load appContext
> >         }
> >     }
> > 
> > so it should load the appContext just once for that testcase, but
> > appContext is always null when entering the setUp() method so its
> > loading the appContext for every test of the testcase, loading the
> > appContext takes alot of time so I only want this to happen once, what
> > do you guys do in this situation?
> 
> Use either TestSetup, which is in the JUnit extensions package, or look 
> at JUnit-addons and the ResourceManager.
> -- 
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand
